On top of all that bullshit, my friend ordered the vegetarian platter and guess what! it took 45 minutes with CONSTANT NAGGING for it to arrive. There was our table of 6, a table of 3 behind us, and a large group of about 10 so the restaurant was not packed. WHERE THE FUCK WERE HIS VEGETABLES? WHAT THE FUCK WERE YOU GUYS DOING, GROWING THEM IN A BACKYARD?!  In a group of six people, 3 people had to continuously nag, one by one, and ask them for water, for tea, for beef.  I'd ask, nothing. My friend would ask, nothing. My other friend would ask, nothing. I'm glad i left you a shitty ass tip, you didn't even fucking deserve one. You know what else? i fucking worked in the restaurant industry for YEARS. I know your ass wasn't doing SHIET.  I dont know what the fuck the other yelpers are talking about, aint no waitress comin by our tables to strain fat from our pots, and we didn't get ANY dessert yet they brought it out to the other tables. The fuck is that bullshit?  I held back on my anger and bitchiness to unleash it all on this review. So guess what Happy Shabu Shabu? You may TASTE better than Cafe Mums, but at least at Cafe Mums they get me fed, and serve my hungry ass up with a quickness and a smile even if it's a half-assed one so...  fuck you.

CpTcmQAdYuYo9Y5Ck18dow.review_text: I've never been to a Shabu place where they give you individual hot pots. I loved that! The lay out is a bit weird though. If you're a party of two, you sit next to each other rather than across from each other and what you see across from you, is another party of 2. So if you look straight ahead, you see someone you don't know eating. Since it's not good to stare, you kinda have to look elsewhere. We came right at 6pm on a Sunday night and the place was full. They recently had a Groupon deal which is why. Waited about 15mins for a table. Once sat down, took about 10 mins for the food to arrive after ordering. They only had 2 waitstaff so getting the bill took a while. Food was good, lots of portion, we were full. You only get 1 broth, no choices.

88DldWGeWUKZwaDit-1hrQ.review_text: This place is great. Went there is weekend and got the all you can eat great price. I dont drink so i didnt get the one with the all you can eat and drink but both are a great deal. I'd come back again next time i'm in the city, and the owner is great.  ohh yeah the lady that lives upstairs is a little crazy!!

dSj_Q7vt6h9V4Oc7r4SS0g.review_text: This is Korean style shabu shabu (i didn't know until a friend told me). I always thought shabu shabu was japanese. Anyways, this place is really clean and all their ingredients are very fresh. They also give u 3 different types of sauces. The tastiest one is the Korean spicy sauce.  Also this is best hot pot i tried. The service gives you a little somthing extra -a ginseng root in all the pots.   They have several different shabus on the menu - one w/ beef, one w/chicken, one w/vegetarian style, one w/beef or chicken & seafood,  or one w/seafood (a plus since they give you a lot of seafood) for several dollars more.  Also they give a complimentary dessert at the end. This is a cool place to just chill!!

L2j8Ci1d30tDU4-kbeOr4g.review_text: Came as a party of 30 people and basically overtook the entire restaurant. It was a friend's birthday celebration so we did All you can Eat and Drink Shabu Shabu. While the tables don't run well for intimate group conversation, it was still really fun to do sake bombs and dine with a friend to share the shabu pot with.   Their sauces aren't as great as I've had elsewhere but it was still good beef. The owner warmed up to the party near the end and came around pouring bai jiu shots for some people because some of us started talking to him in Chinese. Great place for another happy birthday bash!

C-bdGe-Cuzl9j04KPhQxAg.review_text: Went here on a Friday night primetime.  Quickly seated but it was packed with loud bday party revelers, couples and whatnot.  I'd been here a few times awhile back and thought it to be good, not great.  Happy Shabu seems to have new ownership in place because the menu is different (now has all you can eat/drink options) and the quantity of food in regular orders is larger.  I was tempted to get all you can eat but chose the standard beef and it was more than enough.  Lots of noodles and veggies like shitake mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, bok choy.  Sauces included a spicy gochu jang-heavy one that was tasty. I would've liked to have seen flavored broth options.  Cold house sake also quite good.  If you haven't been to Happy Shabu, it's worth another trip to see what is new.

XQU46gFfVmgSjTOTvc5Jew.review_text: $22.95 All you can eat shabu shabu - mmm OK..... $34.95 All you can eat AND drink?! Now we talking! Other than that, this place is your typical shabu joint except its fancied up by the zen-like decor and three dipping sauces - ponzu, sesame, and spicey.

w4ZBwrYODc__W4-Lx0p5kQ.review_text: As we were in search of a late dinner place in the hood, the sudden chilly wind made it clear that we would want some hot soup action over fried chicken at 1300.   The restaurant wasn't too crowded and we decided to sit at the bar as you'd still had to sit side by side at the tables which is kinda a lil odd.   Menu includes al la carte or all you can eat beef, pork or seafood. We ordered 2x beef option. It came with ample veggies, tofu, noodles. Price was reasonable  $16.99 per order. I liked the way they freshly cut the beef just before serving.   They only had the miso as the soup base. (No spicy miso!) it was pretty okay and portions are quite big.   Nothing great but reasonably priced with good ingredients. They should improve the taste of the soup and it will make a difference. Ah also please serve the draft beer cold!   The greatest perk was the yelp deal $25 for $35. With this offer, 2x beef & two Sapporo pint came to $9.68 before tip. Pretty good deal, aye?   Oh also don't forget to check in for the free dumplings to dunk into your shabu shabu!

7oqtGgi7G8WrWVRnfflFGw.review_text: Made a reservation for 3 people and requested that we each have our own pots. They said okay don't worry, you will have your own pots.  Get to the restaurant, and of course, we are sharing pots. I guess making a reservation doesn't really matter. Then I asked him if we can just sit at the tables then so we can just have own pots, and he says no, those are for parties or reservations. I remind him I made a reservation, and he just says no. You're at the counter. Tired of this man's attitude already, I just sat at the counter.  Got the all you can eat option, and that was worth the frustration that the manager caused. Unfortunately, my pot was not boiling the entire time, making me sit and wait for my meat to cook for a much longer time. Asked our waiter to turn it up a bit, then 2 minutes later the manager would come and turn it down. I gave up.  If you sit at the counter, good luck finding room to fit your plates of food. I was so cramped, and my shoulder was aching due to the fact that the pot is extremely far away when you share.  The manager is rude, and doesn't talk to people very nicely, nor does he answer questions you may have.  Next time, I'd rather pay the extra bucks and go to my favorite Shabusen. At least they have amazing service and are some of the nicest people.

0PdFzYFvwdqh7jKqcnroSg.review_text: I've have been here quite a few times. Now i heard they are having all you can eat and drink for a flat price which is good. This place is one of the cleanest restaurants i ever been too. I am not lying!!! The waitress are friendly and taught me how to use the ingredient's to put into my sauces the first time i was there. They scoop the oil from the beef off my pot. Oh... what i love the best is you get your own pot. You don't have to share, just in case any of your friends are sick. I been to other shabu but i like this one by far. Clean!!! Friendly!!!  & Yummy!!! what more can you ask for.

nQL08lhKEGPOA8da4wVP-Q.review_text: Nothing to rave about.  Only one staff member has what it takes to keep the patrons happy, the guy with the black fingernail polish.  The other fella was stoic, drab, did not smile, maybe he is the numbers man.  Anyway the rice was gummy, it was the worst. The place got crowded and staff got slammed, so I understand the lack of attentiveness, to a crazy shabu crowd, they have to keep things movin'.  I won't be back, just not the place to shabu.  Do not bring your date here, fortunately I dined alone, I would have been ticked off otherwise..  Save your money.

4wDZAs9a30snc4ufjLbUBQ.review_text: Shabu shabu was a new experience for me. Luckily, I came here on the opening weekend, so the free sake was flowing' like wine. Food here is fantastic. Very very fresh vegetable, aged beef, cooked to order by you...in your own hot pot. Not familiar with hot pots? It's a big stovetop-heated broth into which you throw ingredients from your (HUGE) plates, and cook each item as long as you want. The variety of dipping sauces, and the broth are excellent compliments to how fresh the food is. If you're not normally one for adventurous dining, I'd say try this place first. You shan't be disappointed.

0IYQrdPM9NPJsRThHfpdEQ.review_text: I came here on a Thursday night with my boyfriend and had a great time!   We were seated promptly, AND served just as fast. Our waitress was Serena! She's such a doll and totally down to have drinks with you! Service was fast and very efficient.   my boyfriend and I chose all you can eat meal. Not only was the meat nice and thin and very delicious--  but the veggie plate (which included 2 kinds of noodles) were very fresh and tasty as well.   As for the sauces, I'm not a big fan of peanut sauce or chili sauce in general so I really rate the sauce by the ponzu-- and dear God the ponzu sauce was...... YUM!!! I like to add extra garlic and onions :)  Anyway, totally give place a shot. Great food and great service at very nice prices!

Le74zCxIjVCaA7z_lxofiw.review_text: Every single time I go to this place, I always have a good time.    The portions are not that great, but the ambiance and the whole "hands-on" technique of preparing your food just the way you like it makes up for that.    One can not say that the food tastes terrible here.  You are in control of how your food comes out!  Ok, I am exaggerating a little bit... but you get the message.   My recommendations?  Get a small lunch beef plate with a side of lobster balls.

bW2LMBS-D-qAgXfpeof3UQ.review_text: From what I remember, the food was very fresh.  I can't really give this a serious rating because I don't really remember what I ate!  haha  I had the all-you-can eat and DRINK with happy hour before.  John, the waiter, didn't help either when he started drinking with us!  I just remembered the beef was really good!  I didn't like the set up because you're so far away from the other people across the way.  You can't talk to anyone on the other side cuz it seems so far away!  But I did enjoy having my own pot and didnt have to share!  haha

WuZBdj8tjjn_QYr5ce2bew.review_text: Kind of a peculiar seating arrangement because each person gets his/her own pot to cook in so the seating is really spaced out. If you go with a larger party be prepared to     sit about two yards away from the people you're facing and talk loudly!   We got the all you can eat/drink option and they were very generous with the food. They had great dipping sauces that they provide, which at other restaurants you have to order separately for an additional cost.   They never let our drinks run low and brought as many pitchers as our party of 8 needed (or didn't need!)  I would definitely go again but make sure it was with a group of friends I already know well. The environment is not conducive to getting to know more than one or two people at a time but for a date or small group it could be really fun and interactive.

tQRRbKWyDwSHo5typ2jKAw.review_text: I can't imagine why this place has received all of the good reviews it has.  There is a reason why when you walk past it on a Friday or Saturday night that it's empty...  The food was mediocre and even though we were only one of two couples in the restaurant, service was slow.  The meat was definitely sub-par as well.  I've been to many shabu-shabu places before but this has to be the worst.  If you're looking for quality food, try elsewhere...

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: Very cheap, low-quality cuts of meat. Marbling is practically non-existent.  Also, this is the first shabu shabu place that I've had in my entire life that mixes their gomadare (sesame sauce) with water to save some $. What the hell. It was super watery and had no flavor. I asked for more gomadare, and they brought back yet another watered-down batch, albeit just slightly less watery... the waitress said, "We gave you a lot, just for you." Umm... can you just give me one that isn't f'ing watered down?  Definitely the worst shabu shabu I've had around here.

PPiYZDUh_gFDIuq9b3r1cQ.review_text: Not too bad. The seating arrangements were the first things I noticed because they're so weird! The tables are like two-seater school desks facing another desk with a huge gap in the middle. I came when the place just opened so it was empty, but I can't imagine how awkward it would be if it were full.   The food is ok. Broth is bland as hell. It's kind of nice you get your own pot but it doesn't help flavor the broth. The meat is whatever.   The upside to the place is that you can share the plates so it kinda makes it a nice, cheap place to eat if you're looking for something filling, but not too filling... with one other person. Not a place for groups with more than 2 people.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: "Happy" Shabu Shabu? Errr, I think NOT!  Unless it's Espetus or The Buffet @ The Wynn, I really don't care for All-You-Can Eat establishments because they tend to be filled with low quality food soaked in fat and laced with enough salt to give me instant heart palpitations. However, this is the quite opposite of HSS, the food is just completely TASTELESS which to me is just as bad.  On Sunday, December 26th, my friends and I (party of 3) came to HSS at 6:30 PM and were promptly seated without reservations. In an effort to shorten my novel of reviews, I'll just give a quick summary:  P R O S: *AFFORDABLE FOR THE PRICE SENSITIVE CONSUMERS. AYCE for $22.95 (Beef, Chicken and Veggies) and AYCE&D (Beer, House Sake, and Soda) for $34.95.  *FRESH WELL-MARBLED BEEF. Tender but NOT high-grade quality "melt-in-your-mouth" tender.  *INDIVIDUAL COOKING POTS  C O N S: *TASTELESS BROTH. The broth was SO watered down that it tasted like water with brown/yellow food coloring.  *BLAND SAUCES -Ponzu: Watered down flavorless colored water -Sesame: Watered down flavorless paste -Chili: Chunky and so salty that it masked the spiciness of the chilies  *ROCK HARD CLUMP OF FROZEN DUMPLINGS from your local Asian market.  *AWKWARD & STRATIGICALLY ILLOGICAL SEATING ARRANGEMENTS.  Individual burners are adjacent to each. If you go with a party of 2, 3 or 4 you will be seated in a straight line and if you want to even have a conversation, you will have to turn and YELL to your left or right which makes it impossible for person #1 to talk to #3 or #4 and vice versa.   Imagine that with a bunch of rowdy drunktards doing the AYCE&D. Yah, no thanks!  *BAD SERVICE. I had to ask 3-4 TIMES for water and rice when there were only 2 tables (party of 3) there. Enough said.  If you're looking for flavorful and high-quality AYCE & AYCE&D Shabu Shabu with far superior service, shell out a couple more dollars ($7 more for AYCE and $5 more for AYCE&D) and go to Shabu House on Geary/15th instead...it will be WELL WORTH IT!!!

eZNhFI6m07dvu1zfLfJc-g.review_text: The meat is good. The sauce, not too much.  If you have a big group, there's a bunch of chairs placed around the tables where certain people might have a bad angle of the pot. Seating is not as comfortable if you have long legs because your knees will be against the side of the table and there is no leg room.  Staffs are cool, alcohol is cool too. HAH!

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: Mmmmm...so yummy. We walked in on a Sunday before  a Sundance flick and were nicely surprised by how smooth the whole dinner went. The hostess is also the server-it's that small. Maybe 6 or 7 long tables and everyone gets their own pot. Mmmmm...food. They have an unlimited menu and a veggie, seafood, combo, and beef. I got the beef and my friend got the seafood/beef combo and so much food came back out!!  They have 3 sauces you can dip it into. Spicy, sesame, and soy I think...and on top of that, fresh green onion and garlic and chili oil. I should have gotten the unlimited-I could have gone eating forever!! Fresh mushrooms and vegetables and thinly sliced kobe beef. Yummy! Overall, the dining experience was phenomenal and the server was so sweet and attentive. I'll be back again.  DEEEELICIOUS!!

0GHsxjCk-Ynzx4Ihj8tjPQ.review_text: This place was okay.  I had heard this place was BYOB but I realized it is NOT when my friends and I arrived with a couple of bottles of wine. The layout is not ideal for groups but the hot pot is pretty good. In terms of service, our waitress was polite but didn't speak English well.

5Ap91V6vM4wgxgJeCu68-Q.review_text: So yes, the service is slow, but the quality of the meat is fantastic - and they slice it thin right in front of you! The veggies are great - good variety. The noodles are FRESH. There are 3 different dipping sauces, in addition to garnishes like fresh garlic, chopped scallions, etc. And my favorite part - each person gets an individual hot pot!

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: I always joke about having shabu shabu, that you can't really complain about the cooking, because they don't have chefs or a kitchen, fridge is all they have.  This Korean shabu shabu is basic, simple, but the beef quality is pretty good. I had the chicken and beef combo for 14.95, not a lot of meat but they put a lot of veggies and rice that will fill you up. Not a lot of choices if you are looking for specific types of seafood or beef.  Service was pretty good but a bit slow so plan on spending an hour or two to enjoy.

KOmZ7cT-n9HwdwnPeY6-qw.review_text: I went here with a good sized group of 20 or so people who were all starving due to a day of intense dragon boat racing.  My first impression was already negative because we had vegetarians in our group who could obviously not eat the AYCE meat and the owner was strict about them not sitting at our table.  This forced 2 of our group members to sit at their own table isolated from others.  Understandable I guess but when we are here with 20+ people I don't think having 2 people in your group sitting with you will be a big deal.  You are already making $1000+ from our group but you're penny pinching.  After we got through that ordeal things picked up and the rest of the night was enjoyable.  I ordered the AYCE and all you can drink (sake and beer) and was pleased.  I'm not sure if the meat quality was good or if I was just starving but I have no complaints there.  Everyone had a good time eating, drinking, and socializing - at one point the same strict owner even came out and started giving us free drinks and even drinking with us.  One of my friends even engaged in a drinking contest with the owner with "fire water."  When we left, the waitress even partook in a chugging contest with some of us.  I would definitely say that this is a fun place to take a big casual group and probably even more fun if you can persuade the owner to start drinking with you.  I hope to come back again next year during my annual trip to San Francisco!

JnGjZVSlfCkKHErvO5ts4g.review_text: $22.95 - all you can eat beef, chicken and vegetables $34.95 - all you can eat beef, chicken and vegetables + all you can drink beer, sake and soda --  The only other shabu place I've been is Mums, and I must say, I prefer Happy Shabu Shabu much more.   Even though Happy Shabu Shabu is smaller, in comparison to Mums: 1) it is less crowded 2) has better and faster service  What I love most is the plentiful pots they have. Never have to share with more than one other person! During our dinner last week, our waitress was super energetic and attentive. Even the owner was friendly. He kept insisting that we get more plates of meat even though we were clearly too stuffed to eat anymore.  The food itself is not bad. There's really not much to expect from shabu shabu. After a while, everything tastes the same. I do like their thinly sliced beef and the variety of vegetables and noodles, plus the 3 different dipping sauces.   I'm always HAPPY to SHABU SHABU here. =P

GuMkSUhINdQlOvZy0MmSTw.review_text: Just went here for a dinner with my girlfriends and I had a good time.  It was a great deal because the food was yummy and the bill was friendly on my wallet.  The broth was a bit bland but after awhile, the garlic and meat flavors permeated the broth quite nicely.  The only thing that was a bit annoying about the experience is the layout of the tables.  Depending on the party size, it could split the people by a big distance because the "tables" (they're more like counters with drawers on the inside to store various things like napkins) are about three to four feet apart.  It's a casual place so speaking a bit louder probably wouldn't ruin the ambience.  I'll probably return here because it's a great deal.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: Remind me not to come back here again. I wasn't really too keen with the quality of the meat nor did I like the watered down dipping sauces. I've had better shabu shabu elsewhere. The service was non-existent. The rice was undercooked. Meh.

3SAAn35I_-kj6a7nqqBAmw.review_text: I thought that the all you can eat for 22.95 was a good price. The beef was yummy and i loved the fact that you had 3 dipping sauces to choose from. the spicy really gave it a kick!  we were there for more than an hour and the plates of beef kept coming. service was good and i really did enjoy myself - its a good option when you don't want to venture to japantown and pay more.   also its pretty cool that you sit with your own individual pot instead of having to share and fight people for your beef/veggies/noodles.

xAosfFk2ubkUuXu-PeX-vQ.review_text: This was my first time trying shabu shabu, and it was a great meal for a cold day.  You get a lot of food and the dipping sauces were yummy.  The service wasn't super friendly/efficient.. just ok.

s_bwB79YSbfJWcqXCUTqBw.review_text: I dont know why I eat here instead of Shabu-Sen. Sometimes maybe I'd rather be on fillmore st enjoying the weirdness of it.  Basically equivalent quality.

JGufZUDWaFEoQjnoIAxX-w.review_text: Staff is super friendly and attentive. Meat quality is so-so. Not kobe! Being that this is a korean shabu they offer three sauces instead of the usual two. I like the gingery one the best. If you order alcohol separate and do not get the all you can eat/drink it is very pricey for your normal bottle of sake. My friend tells me if you go during the weekday before 6pm you get a discount on your meal, so that's a plus. Again I would lean toward Mum's instead. The only advantage is you do get your very own hot pot rather than sharing it with someone else.

n4Xrwlwh2gj6qgUDAcDZCA.review_text: I LOVED this place.  I have been to a couple of other shabu shabu restaurants, but this one definitely takes the cake.  Why?  Because you get your own hot plate, with your own boiling pot and your own cooking utensils and your own dipping sauces.    I love my husband to death, but sometimes I don't want to share.   He ordered the seafood and steak shabu and i got the chicken shabu and we shared that.  The food was MUCH!  Aside from the meat, we got scallops, fish, shrimp, squid, two types of noodles and tons of veggies.    We ate for an hour and we were stuffed!  Good eats, very clean, attentive staff and a fun experience.

rUogQgFEhid8om3oDomeKg.review_text: This was the first time I've ever had Shabu Shabu so I have no basis for comparison.  Keep that in mind.  Ladyhawk and I went here just after moving in to our place because we still hadn't (haven't actually) bought groceries and we were starving.    Awesome thing number 1 = Everyone gets there own hot plate and broth.  Totally radical.  Awesome thing number 2 = The beef/chicken shabu shabu was delicious.  The meat was tender and the dipping sauces were very tasty.  My favorite was the spicy dipping sauce, but the sesame was also very good.  Awesome thing number 3 = They played a killer soundtrack of background music.  I really can't describe it and I'd never heard it before, but it was totally fresh.  All in all, I suspect this place is just average as a shabu shabu joint, but since I have no comparison, I give it 4 stars.  I liked it and the food was tasty.

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: First of all...our service was perfect.  All this huhah about bad service.  Its shabu shabu.  You cook your OWN food.  They brought us our food to cook quickly.  They even skimmed the water to remove the stuff off the top.  The rest...was up to us.   Swishing the beef to cook it quickly.  Dropping the lobster balls into the water to let em cook for 5 minutes.  It was all up to us.  Didn't even know lobsters had balls didja?    The entrees are basic.  If you go with more than one person, i suggest share with your sweetie.  Share two dishes....we had one chicken/beef and one seafood.  Glorious way to get a bit of everything.  We had a large hot sake too.  Seriously...they let you sauce it up with with choices of dip, and give you a frickin salad bar full of veggies.  Thumbs up to shabu shabu!

8mlKio94vJIFp5mR-lR5Bg.review_text: Nothing special about this place.  The food is average.  I can make this at home.  I doubt I will ever go back to this place.

t-JbFC1Oxg5Eqxuek8H_0Q.review_text: $35 for all you can eat/drink special. EH. The think sliced beef and veggies were not that impressive.  The drinks was nice, but that night I wasn't really feeling it. Its just hard to refuse service, especially if you came from the East Bay for a friends birthday.

WM-yXO56qcnJUcPPNRIDVQ.review_text: Yoooo I have no complaints. No frill no bs you walk in and leave happy w a mega grown food baby.  +you get your own pot +better price than any other shabu places +MUCH food  +not crowded  -sauces aren't the best, yes it's watered down but I can deal w that. If you can't... You're gonna miss out on all the awesome things this laid back shabu place has to offer.  I was craving shabu on the way home and it was totally chill to just walk in and sit by myself and have a giant feast at the bar with my very own pot.  Much kudos. Such satisfy.

uo-6DBzvLzL-DDxvF0zYSQ.review_text: Un-happy Shabu Shabu. Maybe the economy is tough right now. That's still no excuse to lie to your customers, serve sub-par meat, or water down your sauce.  1) Their menu says clearly: birthdays free for parties of 4 or more. We tell them it's my birthday at the beginning of the meal, at the end of the meal they card me to confirm, then when the check comes out they say, "Sorry we changed that to parties of 6 or more". I didn't even get the overpriced All-you-can-eat.   It's not about the money, it's the principle. Don't advertise and sell something to your customers, then change it up at the end of the meal. It says something about the place. What else are they skimping on?  2) The quality of the food is mediocre at best. The sesame sauce is strangely bitter, not sweet enough, and very watered down. The ponzu sauce is passable. The meat is sliced too thin and not very marbled so it ends up tough and tasteless. The vegetables are fine. Garlic is chopped up in huge chunks that are way too big.  I'm a shabu-shabu aficionado. It's my favorite food in the world. I'd give this place a 4 out of 10.

SNAjkVZK-J7FzQMDfNLD6Q.review_text: I love how the Shabu tables are set up.  They're so efficient and easy for the waiters to get in and out to refill our meat plates.  I came here on one of my friend's birthday.  They were able to seat 35 people!  It was a lot of fun because we got the all you can eat deal for 30 bucks a pop.  Some people got all you can eat and drink for $45.  I think its a good deal.  They were quick to refill our meat every time we chanted "MORE MEAT, MORE MEAT".  I love that they provided 3 kinds of dipping sauce so I don't get bored of eating the same meat.  Yum. Meat.

pauOTA3dvD944S6IhDAiBQ.review_text: I've eaten here several times before and I always come away satisfied. Shabu Shabu is always fresh and good for you and you really can manage how your broth and food comes out. With that said there's not a lot that has to be done except provide a good amount of food for a good price for the customer, which I think this place does.  I like the decor of the place and I think there's a nice spacing to the place if you come here on a date and just want to talk to the person next to you. But if you have a party of 4 or larger it becomes weird if you don't have one of the two middle long tables.   My one concern is, why on earth does the men's bathroom have a mirror that is positioned only around your groinal region?!?

bAnzGRGuXxtiL-RTsb98pQ.review_text: It looks pretty cute, neat and all. Every person eats here get your own individual pot. However, the service is extremely slow. It's a family-owned restaurant. All they got like 4 people working here(?). I felt sorry for the lady who ended up doing all the work at the front end. Then, there was a guy helping her but he didn't speak English. We didn't have a good experience here. First, the service was so slow we had to get the food from the counter ourselves. Second, if you don't have enough people to serve all the available pots, then you should make shabu-shabu a group sharing experience. A big group can share 1 pot? Maybe Korean has its own style. I have no idea. But it's a waste of space. I didn't quite enjoy it. I think everybody comes to shabu shabu is to have fun with a group of friends. I felt separated by the seating.

QaMPU1xJQaWp5TuxoUE4og.review_text: do you like beef? do you like vegetables? do you like throwing a bunch of stuff in a bowl and then covering it in tasty sauces?   If you have answered yes to one or more of these, then happy shabu shabu will blow your freaking head off. Its really expensive, and most of the time there are some really lame tools there, but the sweet taste of beef makes it all worth it.   located in hilarious japan town

OlElQy5Cpe076eenlqEsbA.review_text: I had better...  I like the fact that this place gives a stove or pot to each person. Places I've been to only gives one per table. For $15-25 depending on what type of protein you want is kindof expensive. There's definitely plAces that you can pay that much for all you can eat.  Soup was ok.. Only one type which was pretty lame. We ordered a side of dumplings and I didn't really like it. Definitely not the typical Chinese restaurant dumpling so be aware!! Overall, I would come again, but if someone else reallllly wanted to eat there.   Service was good. Just food wise isn't my taste.

RBcEDB9DZ2OHMs8WFeS_Vw.review_text: WORST SERVICE EVER.  The food is decent, but service is key to me.  If you have friends that dont drink, this is not the place for you.  They force you ALL to get the All you can eat and drink even if some if your party dont drink.  I walked out.  See ya later.

g6MXRfTylqxlhXzaN3X9BQ.review_text: The service here is HORRIBLE. The waitress is super rude and didn't even seat us when my friend and I came , so we sat ourselves . Next when we were at the table , the server didn't bring us any menus or water . Waited for like 15 mins and then she finally notices us. Funny thing is, it wasn't even busy! Next while waiting for our food she totally forgets our order and on top of that forgets to bring out my friends soup... And it doesn't stop there , we wanted rice and tried flagging her down numerous times .. But it was so hard to get ahold of her I just has to walk up to her and ask. Last but not least, she never checked up on us, never refilled our soup or gave us napkins. Idk if it was because she coincidently just never noticed us or was just ignoring us on purpose. Besides the abysmal service , food was okay .   Very limited options. Only one broth to choose from which is the miso , small variety of veggies , more on the pricey side .. No ice cream.. Eh I just wouldn't come back here again. Not only was it nothing special but the service was just horrible.

uN0c4yh-biPeL15L-kvuKg.review_text: Say, 3.5 stars. I was pretty happy with happy shabu shabu...happy, happy, if you will. There are a couple of negative things that bring the score down: for one, the cold (literally...BRRR!) and sterile atmosphere. And while we're on the topic of sterile, how about the overwhelming odor of lysol that was eminating from the bathroom that they decided to scrub down 2/3 of the way through our meal. The bathroom was already pretty damn sparkly before that. I also encountered an odd, unplacable odor when I first entered.  Ah, well. The people that work there are EXTREMELY nice and attentive. It's BYOB--which I don't necessarily prefer, but it was nice to save some money on a night out for once--and they even provided an ice bucket for the bottle of champagne I brought (WARNING: there are no bottle openers or corkscrews of any kind at the establishment). Also, you don't have to hide your booze as you do at some other BYO estabs. I dig the individual hot pots, and the veggies, dips, and broth flavorings (fresh chopped garlic & onions + miso) were spot on. The beef was nothing special--it was still slightly frozen when they brought it out and wasn't as high in quality as Mum's--but it tasted just fine when cooked. Overall, I prefer Mum's and the $35 all you can eat and drink special, but happy shabu shabu got the job done during Mum's remodling closure.

1Ky883b87muXYlzlBpepgg.review_text: I loveeeee this place. All-you-can-eat shabu for $23!! I think I'm in loveee.  -The beef is awesome. The meat on your plate is nice and folded. It makes it super easy to pick up with your chopsticks.  -I love the brown sauce. -All the servers there are great. But that one night, a waitress kept forgetting some of our stuff (ie: soda, more meat, tea etc). Not a biggie though. She was really nice.   Bottom line is that I will come back for more shabu!

40zXoQtXLOW2u51_AgFCng.review_text: We were craving Shabu Shabu Sunday night around 8pm and drove out to Shabu House, but they had a 1.5 hour wait for a party of four. We were starving and couldn't wait so we phone Happy Shabu Shabu to see if there was a wait for a party of four (which there wasn't). When we arrived, the waitress had already set up our table for us.  I received a copious amount of tea and food with the beef plate (about $15). Tons of delicious veggies and noodles, three dipping sauces, and beef with delicious miso broth. We had to ask for the rice, which was about average.  Excellent service and friendly staff!! Lots of food for the price. Although it's no Shabu House, it's a great alternative to avoid a long line.

wLmC5ODK1dqFhmj1gD-tTQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I were mesmerized by the ALL YOU CAN EAT option here when we were in SF and had to stop by for dinner.  It's about $22 per person for the all you can eat food only but if you want the drink & food combo then it's about $34!  You get a choice of either beef or chicken for the AYCE and another plate full of noodles and veggies like napa cabbage, bok choy, carrots, and tofu.   However, the sauces were a little lame, the peanut sauce was watered down and the ponzu sauce tasted too much like alcohol, like they mixed it with too much sake. So i created my own by mixing the watered down peanut sauce and the spicy sauce, which was good by the way!  I would have given this place perhaps 2 stars but because of the AYCE option, I opted for the 3. Although the service was good when it was given, it was hard to get the attention of the worker since he seemed to be always hiding in the back coming out occasionally to greet new customers or fill water for another large table.   In the end, my boyfriend and I both had three plates of beef each so I would say we both got our money's worth, haha!  **You get your own hot pot, that's a plus!

tGkfSO_bRpXsSI1JYv1wQQ.review_text: Outside of Japan, I have only been to one other shabu shabu restaurant and it was ok. The other night I decided that shabu shabu (and all you can drink) sounded like a great idea and some Yelp results gave me Happy Shabu Shabu.  The fun started out with wandering around the Fillmore area in chilling winds trying to find where the hell this restaurant was. Google Maps showed it IN the Safeway mall. This is a lie. It is ON Fillmore, across the street from the Safeway mall.  When we got there at 9pm on a Saturday evening, it was surprisingly empty. There were maybe 4-5 other customers and another set of 2 walked in behind us. We were seated and the 2 girls behind us got seated.. across from us. At first I was wary because the table had a 1 ft gap between us and the girls and I thought I'd be annoyed at having to listen to them, but I couldn't hear them at all. Good for me, but I can see how a party of 4 would complain about that seating arrangement, as I read in other reviews.  Service was really attentive - our veggie and beef plates came soon after we ordered. Sapporo came in a pitcher and each of us got our own sake. The waitress was quick to come back when our plates/cups/soup looked low and even though we had finished eating and were finishing up a second pitcher, we didn't feel rushed by the staff to leave :)  The beef itself is fine. it's not kobe beef, it's not awful fatty, either. You can ask the waitress to customize your veggie/noodle platter to your liking. The soup looked like miso, but wasn't.  Curiosity: after the first pitcher of beer and sake I wandered to the restroom. While washing my hands, I noticed they had two mirrors - one at eye level for normal sized people like you and me, and one at crotch level. I'm going to assume this isn't a crotch mirror - instead, I'll think that it is a mirror for handicapped (or small Asian) people. All-you-can-drink makes you think a lot about stuff like that.  Tip: put loads of garlic and green onion in your soup in the beginning to start making it flavorful!

b_gVqX6Wi7HwsRT8aCzcQw.review_text: Went here sat night for a friends bday! We had about 22 people-the place fit us all- 3 sauces beef and chicken all u can eat with tons of veggies!!!!!!yummy Sake all the time-the manager was amazing kept my booze coming all night :) Super friendly well staffed-clean Sapporo on tap for all you can drink-seriously it doesnt get better then that

UyhnjAlyMXtbR-qB5kkhlQ.review_text: One-line summary: There are better shabu shabu places in SF. My bf and I prefer Shabu House in the Richmond, although it's less conveniently located.   Minuses * We came with a group of 14 people. One of my friends made a reservation a day in advance. The morning of our reservation, we were told our reservation would have to be pushed back. When we arrived for our late dinner, we still had to wait for over 45 minutes, because a group of loud, drunk Asians were taking their sweet time paying and TAKING PICTURES. They weren't even eating at this point, so the staff really should have politely asked them to clear out rather than keeping us waiting for so long.  * Bad layout. The two people on the innermost ends of the table sat facing large pillars and couldn't see across to the other side without leaning sideways. Awkward!  * The broth wasn't very flavorful. We threw in a lot of hot sauce and chili peppers to give it a boost. The refills diluted the broth even more.  * Two people to a pot. Not a great arrangement if anybody in the group has dietary restrictions.  Pluses * Our waitress was great. She was funny and quick and remained a couple of steps ahead of us by proactively asking if we wanted more plates of meat or vegetables. * The owner (I think) came out halfway through our meal. He seemed drunk and stood between our two tables, babbling and pouring us strong Chinese liquor for free. Quite entertaining.  Other Notes  * Restaurant enforces a fairly standard policy of not allowing only part of the group to order all-you-can-eat, although they were flexible about allowing half the group to order all-you-can-drink. Unfortunately, we had to fight pretty hard for the single vegetarian in the group to pay the vegetarian shabu shabu price. She had to vehemently swear she wouldn't eat any of the meat. Shabu shabu places I've been to with better service are usually generous about giving discounts to vegetarians, especially when only one person in the group claims to be one. * The selection of meats, vegetables, and dipping sauces is pretty standard.

UrcANjPnEtG4G2R6Q3751g.review_text: All you can eat and drink with your friends, birthday person free, yes however they only limit 2 bottles of sake at a time!? seriously thats damn lame, I told the waiter well then you'll be visitng me often, yet on my birthday I didnt really get enough sake bombs. Plus they took away my food before I had a chance to eat it.  I had to constantly nag them to fill up my sake bottle.  Chicken shabu was too bland, steak was allright, its good, only one I would order again. Need to go extremely early to really take advantage of that all you can drink and demand more bottles and pitchers or they're not going to be any good.

f_m10EDr38lMqprr7szNZw.review_text: I am a fan of Shabu Shabu and had only been to one other restaurant.  My friends and I came to this place because it was my friend's bday.    Free birthday dinner, all you can eat AND drink! The food is great! A good assortment of veggies & the beef was prepared nicely.  I wouldn't recommend the chicken, not a favorite.  The employees are attentive, they'll even drink with you and of course encourage you to drink more...why not, all you can drink!  Overall, a great way to start the night off with some friends, good food, & many, many sake bombs!

N2d-MaYCz1xDSa94NHt4cg.review_text: Eat, drink, and be merry! Probably the line this shabu house was founded on! After a long day of touring San Francisco, we were hungry and cold (went up around New Years).  Thanks to Yelp!, we were able to satisfy our tummies with a warm meal of shabu shabu.    We got one order of the ayce and one regular order of beef shabu which was enough to fill me up.  But really, all you can eat AND drink?  So-Cal definitely needs a shabu house like this!

PdSHsYra31zH3fAcE-XAUQ.review_text: I like how previous reviews think of this place as a Japanese or Korean place, but it's clearly Chinese.  Although it's situated in Japantown across the street from several Korean bars, it's obviously owned and operated by a Chinese family.  They age their beef for 23 days and it's very soft and tender, but it's for hotpot so it doesn't really matter....it's gonna be dumped in boiling hot water anyways.  The waitress was pretty hot though and if I go there again, it'll be because of her and not the food.

8p-kv82J5uP3583thTPa4Q.review_text: I gave this restraunt 4 stars because it had great service, all staff was very attentive. 2 waitresses plus the owner came out to replace my meat tray every once in a while. If you didn't know this is all you can eat shabu shabu for 22 bucks, or 35 for all you can drink too.   The 3 stars for the food which the beef has a leaner quality compared to that of mum's which means that its less fatty/less marbled. Meat is still good by all means, and the facilities look much better and are much cleaner.

inz8izVu0oSGeJJdY32zYA.review_text: Eh. . . really not so great.  Yes, the meat was fresh, but the pot was plain old hot water, not broth of any kind.  Plus, the sauces were mediocre.  In fact, only the hot sauce was worthy of my mouth, tongue, and stomach.  The sesame peanut sauce was not peanuty enough.  The ponzu sauce was blah!  What I really disliked, however, was the way they're set up.  Each person gets their own pot, so it's not as intimate as it is as at a lot of other places.  Also, if you have a party of 4 and sit at the table, there's a 2 foot gap between your tables.  I guess if you are germaphobic this place might be good.  But, shabu shabu is about sharing or so I thought!

qUJmdUBUXEy7_73Ie_CWrQ.review_text: the beef shabu shabu is thinly sliced and taste great!  the only thing is, since everyone has their own pot, you sit further away from your friends and it's not as easy to talk.    Extremely yummy noodle served with your order of meat.

gk5BjGoT--YRci9ZJ_WElQ.review_text: I just came here yesterday and I love this place !! This place is kind of hidden because the trees are blocking the sign .. you don't really notice the exsistence of this place . I thought it was a cafe at first lol I was suprised that it was a shabu shabu .  All-you-can-eat for about $22 which is pretty affordable and your money's worth if you ask me . The beef was good . Didn't really like the chicken though .. because it was chicken breast . The noodles and rice were pretty good as well . They give you a side of kimchee as well . The dipping sauces were really good esp. the red one . This place is pretty clean too and the coolest thing is that everyone gets their own pot !! The dessert was just perfect to top it all off . Not too sweet but just enough to hit the spot . It was fresh watermelon and honeydew juice with tapioca . The service was just amazing .. very friendly people . They  stop by every now and then to remove the stuff on top of the boiling water and to ask if you need more beef , dipping sauces , etc. The owner or whoever it was even asked us at the end of our meal if there was anything they can improve on . We told him we didn't like the chicken and he put in consideration of using black meat instead of using white meat meaning meat from the thigh and other parts of the chicken instead of chicken breast . They close at 10 but we stayed until 10:30ish which was when they were cleaning up and everything . They didn't try to rush us to finish or pay the bill . Their service was still just as good as it was at first . I give them props for that because usually people make you pay and leave . This is now my favorite shabu shabu joint and I must admit this place really suprised me .. it was more than I expected . I'm definitely coming back again !

TSs6cGV6N1EAWb5ovnKLPg.review_text: not-so-happy shady shady is more like it!  stay with me, i promise you this won't be JUST an angry rant on the horrible and unprofessional customer service here. before coming in here last night, i called to make a reservation for two. they said they only accomodated reservations for parties of 3 or more. okay, understandable.  so thinking that it'd be busy (and because i wanted to be a gentleman and not have my date to wait outside in the cold in the case that it WAS busy),  i made the reservation anyways, saying that i would get another person to make it a party of 3.  we showed up for the reservation and to my surprise NO ONE was there. well, i lied. chad michael murray and paris hilton were there with the rest of the cast of the house of wax on the television and jimminy cricket fully orchestrating out-dated k-pop music with his family of crickets. other than them, we were the ONLY customers there.  because i didn't want to make things awkward, i pretended to just be a walk-in customer, and not the intended reservation for 3. the layout is kind of weird. think of the set of iron chef or master chef or any of those cooking competition shows. yeah, the tables were side by side hot pot stations. it felt like i was entering an arena to compete for the next iron or master chef. there were a couple of tables, so naturally i asked the server if we could sit at a table. he looked at me with a blank expression and told me they were for parties of 8 or more. i persitted and asked politely, because you know, they were SO JAM PACKED BUSY... still, no go. we were ushed to THE BAR. THE. BAR. i let it go, and we sat at the bar.  i ordered the all you can eat ($24/person) and a large sake and sapporo. the sake and beer, you really can't mess that up. the food itself, decent. all you can eat comes with beef, chicken, and veggies. the three sauce combo was good; consisted of a paenut based suace, a hot sauce, and a soy/teriyaki sauce. ready for THE RINGER?!? here we go...  ten minutes into sitting down, TWO GIRLS walk in. they asked to sit at a table. you remember the tables for parties of 8 or more i mentioned? yeah those. were they, too, ushered to THE BAR? nooooo, THEY WERE SEATED! oooooh, child. boy was lucky i was on a date, otherwise all hell was going to break loose.  besides the awkward layout and the fact that we were ushered to THE BAR instead of being seated at a table because we were gay guys on a date and not girls and the fact that i was LIED to, the food was alright.  thank God for my patience and undrestanding for not blowing up in front of my date and ruining the rest of the night.  shout out to the server in th red sweater last night with the poor k-pop harcut, because of YOU, i am NOT coming back. nor should ANYONE ELSE.

AM8mCaiKtiZnM2N2qGexpw.review_text: Not great but not awful. Went in with 8 people and though they had a party coming that would force us to move before the 2 hours was up they accommodated nicely with extra beer and sake. Recommended if you're in the area but I wouldn't seek it out

lii0UYXJf_44hJbHtALM3g.review_text: I can definitely see where the reviews are going with service, no matter how busy it is they only have one poor guy running around. But honestly, you should lower your expectations for service at asian restaurants. Pho? Sucks. Real Chinese food? Sucks.  What matters is that the food is good.  The food is great and $26 for all you can eat is a deal. Beef is good quality, cut to order and the vegetables are always fresh.The sauces are more watery but the miso soup you cook in is strong  already so I actually think a hotpot style sauce would be too much.

OvEH3jzoSeVv5DxcmP65fg.review_text: Positives:  - Very high-quality beef, at least for the price.  Good marbling. - Happy hour pricing.  It's a decent place to get loaded with a large group of people. - A good dining spot after concerts at the Fillmore.  Negatives:  - The dipping sauces are awful.  They taste Korean; this isn't shabu shabu. - The seating format is terrible.  Individual burners make conversation impossible. - Attracts "I'm having my first beer!" clientele.  Avoid, unless you don't have a better alternative.

6E3qqbyqn7C2sFm_7qa4Gg.review_text: I'm writing this review as I wait for waiter to get me water. This is my third time asking.  We have a party of 16... And all ordered AYCE to make it easy. With that option, you are NOT allowed to order beer on the side unless you wanted to make it AYCD also. What a shady scam! We also checked in on Yelp and asked for our free dumplings, but were told that it cannot be redeemed tonight? What. The. Hell. It didn't say that on the check-in deal just like how it didn't say you couldn't order one glass of beer on the side if you get AYCE. Btw, where is my water?   Food: The broth was bland -- tasted like watered down miso soup. You are basically boiling your food in water and an ishhh ton of MSG. Pork tasted as if it was chopped from a 78 year old dead pig no one remembered to bathe the first 77 years of its life. The scallop wannabe lookalike chicken tasted disgustingly bad like rotten eggs. The only decent thing about this place was their three sauces to dip your smelly food in.  Last, but not least... Where is my water?

g94lYUt_-OVpVTPumC8g9A.review_text: rude much?  I'm not sure how they even stay in business with service like that.   We came in on a Friday, they sat us at the counter. My bf sat to my right rather than my left, the waitress RUDELY told him to sit on the other side. Geesus lady, you could have asked politely. I was about to walk out then, but my bf was nice about it and moved to the other side.   When she took our order, she was extremely impatient as well. As if our ordering offended her.    While the food tasted okay, I've had better elsewhere, their service for this place is a -10.  Never coming back.

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: We've been going here for years. With groups of 10-20 people. We've brought a lot of business to this place and last night was our last time there. Sometime during our loyal years, they instituted a rule that if one person orders all you can eat, then everyone has to. We've adhered to this policy over the years and have remained loyal customers, despite their lack of trust for us. There were only four of us this time, the four people who have brought them a majority of their business through the years. For once, my friend only wanted a vegetarian meal, my husband and her boyfriend wanted all you can eat. We were at the table which was split two and two across from each other, so it would have been obvious if she was snagging pieces. I offered to even just order a beef plate (instead of all you can eat) and sit on the side with her. The tables are considered two separate tables, but the management is so obtuse, we were brought with the excuse they couldn't do that since the order was already put in.  We changed the order, instead of having 3 all you can eat/drinks and a vegetarian, everyone each had a plate and one drink.  Happy Shabu Shabu is going to fail as a business. In a city with great food and better Shabu Shabu places, they just lost an entire large group of people who brought in so many businesses during the years. Business that would come even when their restaurant was empty. We spread the word and had our friends go (even without us) and we are just as easily going to spread the world telling everyone to go elsewhere. Maybe next time the owners give a business a shot, they'll learn to be more customer focused. Especially to those who have showed so much loyalty.

uXR9RFAuCw2uFz04bvgsMg.review_text: Good shabu shabu, even if the staff is a little surly.

p2dPm6VUj-zKm_GHXEyB0A.review_text: I made reservations for a group of 7.  When we got there, we had to wait a long time for 2 customers to clear a table so our group to sit together (you can't move tables around in a shabu shbau place as easily as your typical joint). Also, mind you, the place was more than half empty and the restaurant could have seated them elsewhere. Poor planning.  With that said, the waitress was super nice and food was really good. She helped us mix our sauces and was attentive to the temperature and cleanliness of our pots.    This is a BYOB place but I think they are about to acquire a liquor license. Prices are reasonable, in the $13 range or so. It was a little strange that we were the only ones there on a Sat night, but I would go again.

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Been to many shabu houses and *Meh. I've experienced better*.  My friends and I were seated in the back corner and the seating arrangement was a bit weird.  I was facing another table of two and I felt like I was sharing a table with them.  AKWARD!  The soup base is what makes a hot pot restaurant successful.  I love spicy soup base and the soup base here was bland. The owner walked around and asked if everyone was okay and if there was anything he can do; that can make our dining experience *even better*.  Def a great way to network and get peoples opinion, this was actually when Happy Shabu Shabu first opened.    I told him the soup is not spicy enough and if he can make it spicier.  He came back with his own mix of sauce called "mah lat" and put it in my soup.  This def spiced up my meal. :)   Nothing really stood out for me to come back and since I checked out this place when it first opened, I wouldn't mind giving this place a second chance.  I will be back to TRY again some day and hopefully bump up the stars on yelp.

Gq0MP4dn2uu7ucEHZpWwxQ.review_text: We came here for my friends birthday.....  I would have to say there are MANY other shabu places that serve better food, and have way better service!   First of all, if any of your party gets the all you can eat&drink combo, you will have to either choose to not drink at ALL or get the all you can eat&drink combo as well.  I'm not a big drinker, so I wanted to get the large beer with all you can eat food, but unfortunately since some of my party was getting unlimited drinks, I had to either choose to do the same or nothing at all! So I ended up not drinking at all.    Second of all, We had a a lot of left over food! They would'nt provide us a box to take the left overs simply because it was all you can eat.. Therefore, a LARGE plate of food was just put to waste, and thrown away.  Horrible!!!!!!!!

4tMVO9I0esafnY7tj6bpbQ.review_text: If "half star" rating was possible, I would have given this place a two and a half star.  That's because they didn't have ANY high chair for my 20 months old little boy.  This is certainly the first restaurant I've been to, that doesn't carry any high chair (they said that's because the one, and ONLY they had, broke down just a few days ago.  Hmm...)   I would have left the place under this condition, but we had to give this place a shot since other family members were there for a "family dinner".  We opted for the "all you can eat" choice on the menu  (+): - You have your own cooking pot right in front of you - convenient, practical and personalized. - Beef is good and tasty. - Good variety of vegetables, and noodles on the vegetarian platter - Service is attentive and friendly.  (-): - The sauces are pretty simple, and the peanut sauce tasted quite bland. - After a couple of bites of the chicken, we just  stuck to the beef.  The chicken is really dry and tasteless. - No high chair: Having to eat Shabu with a toddler sitting on your lap makes the whole experience much less enjoyable.

NALHOp0E1RcJSeeklLHacA.review_text: Fun for a large group and these people will entertain you. During a birthday our waiter managed to being over fire water to the table (I think he had a little too much himself that night).  Had a lot of fun so the atmosphere is great, however I am not a big fan of filing meat - so for me the food is what is a 3 star experience!

EMJjHTT5e27qCEZC_MKmlw.review_text: I have to laugh as drunken memories of cooking my own food at Happy Shabu Shabu. What interactive fun, and saki bombs go perfectly with endless plates of beef. I would come here every weekend before we go out at night and the food got better with time. Great service, say what up to Jeff for me if you go. Can be a family place as well, All-you-can-eat plates are clutch, and they make it so you almost have to get it because 1 plate alone is 65% of the price. Fresh and Fun.

DV1g380u_FvG6TGRwfhYBg.review_text: I went to Shabu Shabu last night for a friend's birthday party and was disappointed.  The shabu concept is fun, but my experience w/ one of the servers (manager?) at this place ruined the experience for me.   There were nine people in our party - everyone except me and my boyfriend ordered the all you can eat/drink.  After explaining to the waiter (manager?) that we didn't want the all you can eat/drink, he essentially accused of having the intent of ordering the normal meal and then drinking the alcohol of our friends "on the side."  And this was after my boyfriend tried to order his own alcoholic beverage, and was informed that the only way he would be served alcohol is if he ordered the all you can eat/drink.    the food was nothing special.  when the bill came, we asked the waiter to split the bill between all of the people evenly.  Somehow I received a bill that was more than other people's bills (90 bucks!) (and I did not get the all you can eat/drink).  Because it was a friend's birthday, others gave me cash to make up the difference between what I should have paid and what I was charged, and someone else was already in some sort of dispute w/ the manager, I let it go.  Although thinking of it today, I think that it is possible that he charged the party as though my boyfriend and I got the all you can eat, when we did not.  I don't know that for sure though.  I would never go back again.  In addition to the food being nothing special, I felt uncomfortable and unwelcome the whole time.  Also, I wouldn't recommend going here for a group event, because the design and placement of the cooking tables do not allow you to sit close enough to those you are facing to carry on a conversation (without yelling).  Our party was essentially split into two groups, and the birthday person couldn't talk to half of her party.  Bad experience overall.

2EZLYcTrqPC2r3XA1_MWeg.review_text: It was okay.   I've had better shabu but the beef at this place was nice and fresh.  The tables/shabu pots are arranged pretty far apart so to avoid shouting across the table, we all sat side by side.  I also didn't like it when they shut my pot off kinda early.  I was still cooking stuff.  The food was good though and that 's most important.

CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q.review_text: Sarah L. told me something about shabu shabu meaning "swish swish." For beef or whatever, you're not suppose to dump everything into the pot, but swish it while holding your chopstick for a few seconds. I felt like family coming in here, I think it's a family owned business...not sure. Workers greeted us & they were also nice & attentive. I'VE ALWAYS WANTED TO COME HERE!!!!!!!!!!! I've walked by once (it wasn't open yet, open at 5pm?) after seeing it on yelp, I never knew where it was located until I went to go sing K, which was across the street. Today Sarah L., the fam & I went for my popo's birthday. Popo never likes to go to restaurants for her bday, but I guess someone convinced her. I remember wanting to come on my birthday or some other event last year, but I didn't, I don't remember why. I kept this bookmarked since the beginning of the year. I saw pictures on yelp that celebs came here to eat, I wanted to come even more. I found yesterday we were coming here, I was SO EXCITED, couldn't contain my happiness. I have never gone to a restaurant to hot pot with family before, wait...I have, BUT that was years ago. When you first walk in, there is a bar and to the left of the bar are tables with individual hot pots. Tables had rows of 4? but we sat on the side, so there were rows of 2 & they faced each other. Pros or con: Seats are in rows/bar/diner-like fashion. I'm all for only having to talk to 2 people (whoever is on my right & left side), because of my anti-social tendencies. In the beginning I was hesitant not sharing a pot, but I ended up liking it. Didn't fight for food, made my VERY OWN soup. My fav items were the fish ball things with fish eggs (10minutes to cook), thinly sliced beef (the kind you would shabu shabu), mushrooms, squid & mussels were good too. Beef was so red & fresh, it really did look marbled, like this yelp.com/biz_photos/2Tgh… Shrimp didn't have shell on the body, just the head, so the heads fell off when you boiled it too long? Suck the shrimp head, yummm yelp.com/biz_photos/2Tgh… Cousin only ate beef, his soup was so good, tasted like beef stew. Sauces were good too, the soy sauce looking one with green onions was probably my fave. Chili on the table if you want it spicy, I can't eat spicy so I couldn't use it. If you bring kids, make sure you keep an eye on them. I can imagine kids wanting to put stuff in the pot & burning themselves OR asking if their food is ready yet. Drinking all the hot pot soup always makes me want to pee A LOT, make sure you're always near a toilet after you eat. The restroom was nice, clean & smelled nice. Any restroom like that gets an extra star. After shabu shabu-ing, with the right people & places to go, it was the perfect Saturday. It felt like I was on summer break, didn't worry about the midterms next week. This should have been my 200th review, owell.

OTWeSSO-ZEx1oVnYEYppyg.review_text: straight up, the food was ok (since i am from LA and you barely get horrible shabu's there), but why 1 star? because the owner does horrible customer service. doesn't even know how to treat customers right, and maybe thats why he's up north because he knows he's shabu won't survive if he opens it in LA, lol

fndYlWBXCGu1vL5y8-kr4Q.review_text: Lame.  I made a reservation for 8 over a month ago for my friend's bachelorette party.  They call me the night before to confirm.  I call back the next morning and am told that they gave our table away to another guy because I didn't answer when the restaurant called me the night before.  Huh?  What kind of procedure is this?  They offered to seat us at the bar...8 people...all in one row.  Wow, how accommodating right?    So, thinking about celebrating an occasion with a large group and want to book somewhere in advance?  Don't call this place.  They will kindly take your reservation and then not honor it...f-ing up your plans.   Thanks a lot.  You should take the Happy out of your name and rename yourself Unreliable and Rude Shabu Shabu.  A-holes.

VjUuaL2A0QwrRZ8hDdFf7Q.review_text: yes, i know that all those little bottles are for seasoning the broth, but i didn't pay good money to cook absolutely everything!  i should at least have a base to start with! (see review for shabu house)  the seating is awkward - not recommended for large groups.  i thought the food was ok, but 2 of my friends got tummy aches!

VGqczSrHQY5FAGhuPc8EXg.review_text: Not really impressed by the food. The beef's not so fresh, the soup base's just water.  The staff are friendly and attentive. But that's just about it for this restaurant.

6XbiHmXB3oxBQIztMRMB7Q.review_text: We went here long time ago. Their shabu-shabu was pretty good too but we don't really come back here since shabuway is in town now.

7i2JyM5gVZnXtsgb7zCdtg.review_text: Finally! I get to Shabu.   First of all, this place is small. A max capacity of maybe 30 customers.   Second, the seating is weird. We sat at a table for 4 that had a walk way inbetween. To converse we had to yell across the table. This is mainly due to the individual hot pots.   We ordered the All you can eat and drink option. Unlimited Beef or chicken, Asahi, Sapporo, and hot Sake.   The soup base, well, I don't really recall what the ingredients were. But, I saw the waiter dump some yellowish base into the water. You can add your own green onions and/or garlic.   The beef was well marbled and looked in good quality. Much better than the beef I got at Little Sheep. I did not order any chicken, but why? I eat chicken everyday. They also include a vegetable and noodle plate which consisted of cabbage, mushroom, and glass noodles. Dip with the 3 sauces if you like.   The beer and sake really filled me up and gave me a good buzz. Perfect because we were planning to head over to the Sens club venue after. I love going to a club smelling like beef. mmmm. The girls dig it. ;p   The servers were not as attentive as we would have liked. Our beer glasses were constantly empty. Maybe if they hired more than 2 servers?   Now I need to try Shabu house, but they are always packed to max capacity. Someday... :(  Price:39.99 pp

3PtaX4yUBsZs8sQs_fH1CQ.review_text: Good shabu Shabu.  Would repeat.  Great price - large portions.  GREAT sauce (recommend mixing them for different flavors)

tvjL4BErlkBNsSyLjkEzFg.review_text: Despite the 3-star review, I really did enjoy eating here.  There was no wait, the place was clean, and it wasn't crammed in with stools and chairs like most shabu shabu houses.  A word about the service, there were two servers - one was friendly, efficient, and eager, while the other was... not.  But the good thing about shabu shabu is that the service has less impact on the quality of your meal.  If you see other reviews that comment on the service, just consider that I had one that acted as though she owned the place (in a good way), while the other acted like her mom owned the place (i.e. she was forced to work and couldn't care less).  It's good to know that when I want shabu shabu but don't have time to wait at other places like Shabu House, that there's always an option.  It's like if you really, really want Zachary's Pizza, but decide that that line is too long, so you go to the Round Table across the street.  Sometimes that's OK (and sometimes it's not).  PROS: - No wait, plenty of seating - Clean, great vegetables (and noodles are included)  CONS: - Dipping sauces weren't the best - Broth wasn't flavorful

jblrwi7sij21ZV8mUNHRSw.review_text: For all you all-you-can-eat & all-you-can-drink shabu shabu lovers, I heard that this place is better than my all-time fave, Cafe Mums.  So, I gave in to the hype and finally tried it on Tuesday.  It was pretty good, but I can't say that this is better w/ a straight face.    I don't think you can truly compare Happy with Cafe Mums.  Happy has more of a Korean influence, where Mums tends to be traditional Japanese.  Both of them have the same all-you-can-eat & all-you-can drink deal for similar prices.  However, Happy does have alternatives to the beef of chicken or seafood.  Their dipping sauces are also a little bit different than the ponzu and peanut-based sauce at Mums, but they also have a spicy & sour 3rd dipping sauce.  Last but least, we had a Korean dessert of pureed watermelon, which was actually a little too green.  I prefer the selection of ice creams at Mums, especially the Green Tea.    Feel free to try it for yourself, but most of the Mums faithful will probably agree w/ me.  Enjoy!

0ximOW5EKh12QqTPfAYXJQ.review_text: Don't come here for the AYCE, come here for the AYCDRANK!!  The couple times I've come here, it's always been a good time.  The seats are sort of far from each other so with a group of 8, you may have to sit 4 and 4 with bar seating facing each other. You get your own pot, service is mediocre but they let you run free with you AYCE/D.  You can get out of your seat, mingle with your friends, be as obnoxious as you want and they won't kick you out.  It's shabu-tastic!  Also, the owner seems to love groups who come to his restaurant for drunken celebration and warning, he will try to drink with you!  He will offer you what my friends and I call "fire water." It comes in a unlabeled glass bottle and is a clear liquid that smells like rubbing alcohol. It is very strong, burns anything it touches and may actually kill you if you drink enough of it.  Ok, I made the last part up.   But I have had friends take shots of this fire water with the owner and end up really sick in the bathroom and outside the restaurant. Boo. Honestly, the food and service both are not great. They never refill your soup if you ask, and take forever to bring out more meat, but they will provide plenty of sake.

fTV_ERFkyHXRNRG3fnsBiA.review_text: I love this place! I went here for the first time last week with a friend and it was perfect. We each got the $23.95 AYCE Beef, Chicken and Veggies. I think it was like $34.95 with the alcohol and soda. The beef was bomb. My friend had a total of 3 plates of it and I only had one. I didn't like the peanut sauce, but the other 2 were BOMB so I could overlook that! Besides, I'm not a peanut sauce fan.  I'm looking for others to dine with me. Looking forward to visiting this place again!

vll5y3X-Jxk4aNYyYFS8xA.review_text: Came here the evening of Valentines day with a party of 4. The venue was a lot smaller then anticipated but we were seated right away even when our entire party wasn't present yet, and my original reservation was for only 2. (You would think all restaurants would be packed for Valentines day evening, but not Happy Shabu Shabu).   Every person gets their own boiling pot, but the seating arrangement was quite disappointing. Our party of 4 had to sit in one row facing another party of strangers. The only people that could really converse are the two sitting in the middle of the table, but good luck trying to talk to the person at the far end.   I believe their popular option is the "all you can eat all you can drink" for $34.99. One member of our party did get this and they were quite consistent in bringing him more plates of meat and refilling his beer. They also have a "all you can eat" option for those less alcoholics in mind.  I decided to get the half beef half chicken option for $14.99. They bring you a plate of meat and a plate of vegetables. I kept forgetting the water is boiling hot and trying to stick burning hot vegetables in my mouth wasn't the smartest idea. In my opinion, the beef tasted way better than the chicken, even when I usually prefer chicken in other scenarios. After being cooked, the chicken tasted very hard and dry. The beef was softer and carried a bit more flavor. The sauces provided where not the greatest, especially the peanut butter flavored one.  In conclusion, this place is great if you want to eat as much and/or drink as much as you want for a set price, but don't care too much to converse with your party because you will not be facing them. It seemed to work out great for the people who just sat there and ate and drink without talking to their dates! The prices are a little higher compared to other Shabu restaurants in the city, so choose wisely before settling.

0mOb1_pmBlV1a85lfkqCCg.review_text: Come to this place for the all you can eat and drink only if you have nothing to do the next day because you will be hurting. They don't slow play you at all with the beers and if you strike up a conversation with your server they will give you all the fire water you want. Sauces could be more flavorful but overall the food is good.  I have read reviews complaining about the service. These servers have personality and take it just as good as they give it. They are having fun and some of the up tight patrons need to loosen up and have a good time with them. If you are going to place that is all you can eat and drink what are you expecting service wise? This is a place to have fun not show how pretentious you are.

ZNfxtYQRvOc4pErDSEF8Vw.review_text: Me and Shabu Shabu were made for each other.  This was my first experience with shabu shabu, and holy cow is that a lot of food.  I'm a big eater but that was ridiculous.  It was $35 for AYCE and DRINK (beer and sake).  Like some others on here said, the broth isn't special and you have throw most of your "fix-ins" to get any flavor out of it, but the meat and the vegetables are fresh.  The service was pretty good (though it was mostly empty that night) and they didn't mind when I asked for the next plate to be all of a specific vegetable, or all chicken, or all beef (it was a long night).   I probably wouldn't come back here, but I'm definitely checking out the next shabu shabu place I can find.

5KtOX6QV5Wxcd2onINvzxw.review_text: We went here for the fiance's birthday dinner.  It started as a party of 12 and ended up a party of 6.  They set up a table at the back of the restaurant for us - we sat 3 and 3.  Just a note for large parties, there's usually an uneven number of seats on each side.  It was great though - we could still hear each other talk across the cooktop tables.    I like the fact that they put spices in your cooking pot.  You can get your meal cooked as mild or spicy as you'd like.  The food is cheap - $15 for beef or chicken, $25 for seafood, and they have all you can eat and drink for $35.  Can't beat that!  I ordered the beef and chicken, it was plenty of food for me.  You get a healthy serving of beef and chicken, a plate full of veggies, tofu and two kinds of noodles, three dipping sauces (the spicy one was the best) and rice (I finished two bowls.)  A note on the owner/manager/guy that was there - we'd like to call him "Stan" because he reminded us of our friend.  He was awesome!  He's who I talked to when I called to make the reservation.  He was really easy to work with and told me I could bring a cake in and they would serve it.  When I got there, he moved us to the back table because there was only six of us.  He gave my fiance a free beer and took shots of sake with us.  Talk about hospitality!  He let me go in the back to get the cake and convinced me to put 30 plus candles on the cake and helped me light them, and then helped me serve it to our guests.  I appreciate the extra mile of service and can't wait to go back to hang out with "Stan."  Overall a great experience.  We were full afterwards.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: Hands down! This is my new favorite! The food is here is so super fresh and of such high quality. The service is very warm and welcoming. I must warn you though, the rule is that each person must order for themselves here. No sharing! (Hence, the removal of a star.) The portions are GINORMOUS and both my friend and I couldn't finish. It was a great meal!

p6nBKyT9Y_pFJ1WxVEowwA.review_text: Recipe for disaster...but a good disaster. One part AYCE, one part AYCD. $35, 2 hours. If at all you are able, control yourself. To be honest, I had no idea this was going to be AYCD so when I found out...the game was on. If you were like me, you began 'shooting' the carafe of warm sake. May not want to do this right away. And if you're really good, the strong stuff might come out. Don't do more than 3...unless you think you might be strong enough to stand in front of a bus. All the staff was nice for our group of 14.

zk7fXC5RFGiBMCnym6ihng.review_text: This is my 3rd time coming to this place.. and every time its been thaaaaa bommmmmmb!! $35 all you can eat and drink. That just means alllllll youu cannn parrrrrty!!! All three times were for birthday parties.. They are really good with accommodating big parties.. Service was great, food and drinks just kept coming and coming. Sighhh..! That was a sigh of pure satisfaction. Full to the brim.

VMakUjCziVNgLdsmoTj9-Q.review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here on Friday night. We had a group of 5 partaking in the "all you can eat & drink" bonanza, and it was out of control. I am a person who really enjoys having control of my meal, so obviously my self-contained boiling pot of broth was a TREAT to manage as I cooked up various meats & veggies. I also am obsessed with sauces, so imagine the joy of having 3 varieties that you can also spruce up with onions & garlic at your leisure. Basically, it's a control freak's dream. Add in the luxury of unlimited sake bombs throughout the duration of your meal, and what's not to like?  The only reasons I couldn't go 5 stars is that if you have a group, you have to sit kinda far from each other and shout across a mini-canyon to make yourselves heard. Also, the manager roams around with "fire water" shots that make you feel like you MAY die after you take it. It's probably like, windex or something. But hey, free alcohol and a festive atmosphere, so who's complaining.
