pKqIk1NpORfU6tEDW9S2xQ.review_text: Ok, so i went here yesterday for the first time in about 4 yrs.  Everything is so much more lively now.  I remember when i was here before it was dull boring but now its rocking.  I loved their music, perfect for eating like crazy and drinking like crazy.  lol.  All you can eat meat is only like 22 bucks, and all you can eat and drink is like 34 bucks,  so its reasonable.  I chose the all you can eat and drink cuz i drink more than that 12 dollar difference, haha.  The meat was tasty with 3 diff choice of sauces.  I picked the spicy soup base which was also very good.  I loved how each person gets their own pot which makes it personalized.  Oh yea and watch out for the hot waitress, she may come and drink with you. But be careful, you may get really buzzed. lol

ey4L4an9m1pEi0NK8Ybepg.review_text: I love this place.  All you can eat beef!    The staff is very attentive and helpful, giving us tips on what to put in our broth and kept the plates coming.    As others have mentioned, their seating arrangement is not ideal for socializing, but I tend to focus on cramming the sliced beef into my mouth so it's not much of an issue for me :)

8JC0TnD1YQMTMyAOuDM56Q.review_text: We only came here because of a groupon and the fact that i LOVE shabu. There's no option for broths so by default you get a miso broth. Sad that there's no lamb but we ordered 2 beef shabu and a side of pork (which is one whole plate for $10). The beef has nice marbling and they give you a large amount.  Sad that there's no bowl of rice included and that the sesame sauce sucks. It tastes like bottled runny sesame instead of thick cold fresher tasting sesame sauce. I don't think AYCE is worth it here and there are plenty of better quality places with more of a selection in the city but for what we got and paid, it was good.  They should probably hire one more waiter to help bus tables/take orders. We watched one party come and go just because they were trying to order the the waiter was way too busy.

9ahCDfcVHndH0ZTF2kMKAw.review_text: (Un) Happy Shabu Shabu is terrible! My boyfriend and I usually go to Shabu House on Geary, but decided to try a new place.  Ugh!  When we first walked in, it smelled like a toilet.  My boyfriend made the mistake of ordering the chicken.  It took him forever to cook it. I had the beef, which was frozen. I would rather have plain water than the miso broth.  It was totally bland.  I gave 1-star because our waitress was really awesome.    Great service, terrible food. Will never come back again!

P0sx_XYaCj2DWhRdf25yzQ.review_text: Here's the thing, if I were rating the food it would be more like a two.  The broth is flavorless and the meat gets overcooked too quickly (okay maybe thats my fault).  I liked the unlimited vegetables a lot - good variety and we fought over the mushrooms -- but eh, maybe shabu shabu is just not my thing. Or I'll try it somewhere better.  Buttttttt I still say go to SHABU SHABU WITH LOTS OF PEOPLE!. I went with a group of like thirty and we were drunk and disorderly but nobody gave us a hard time, just kept giving us beer and sake. It was a little cold outside but where else could they seat us all? Owner gave us shots of firewater woohoooo  So yeah, don't go for the food but if you and friends want to just pregame for a couple of hours or have a chill (but drunken night) this is a great option. Be sure to bring a camera!!!  Note 1: If you have enough to drink, Fillmore karaoke is right across the street . . . you know you feel the beat.  Note 2: be careful! i have a giant cut on my wrist where I hit my hand against the hot shabu pot!

MSkN2ieSx3uu6WH728KriA.review_text: My FAVORITE place in the Fillmore!  All you can eat and drink for under $40?  ARE YOU SERIOUS?  The service is GREAT, too... very attentive and they don't hold back on giving you sake or beef refills.  YUM YUM!!!

bmlyCwIIi32-MlL7mBbbNA.review_text: me:      "shabu shabu!!!".........              "hey... hey!!  SHABU SHABU!!!!!"...........              "HEY!!!! Over here!!!"  waves chopsticks around  sister:   "WHAT???"  me:       "I said SHAAAABU SHAAAAABU!!!"  sister:  "Yeah I heard you the first time"  me:       "whaaat?"  sister:   "I SAID I HEAAARRRDDD YOUUUU the FIRRRST TTTTIME!"  me:       "Yeah I heard you too....now SHAAAABUUU SHABBBUUUUUU"  sister:   "Why do I eat with you?"  me:       "whhaaaaat?"  Davids bottom line-  The seats are like 6 feet away from each other.  Kinda nice to have your own pot but they should have the optional shared tables so a party of 4 isnt seperated by what feels like a huge crevasse.  I had to walk all the way around the long table to pour my brother in law soju shots.  It was like mini work outs built into my meal... and my boss says im no good at multitasking.  hmmph.  I still annoy the crap out of everyone when I shabu shabu my meat.
